title: Liverpool train ahead of Burnley clash as Joel Matip calls for Reds to show some consistency
text:

Liverpool's players trained at Melwood on Tuesday as defender Joel Matip spoke of the need for consistency in the run-in. 
Jurgen Klopp put his stars through their paces ahead of this weekend's game against Burnley, with the Reds looking to build on their 3-1 win over Arsenal. 
The Reds were firmly in the title picture up until the new year but a run of just two wins in eight matches since the start of January has seen them drop out of contention. 
Bizarrely, those two wins came against Tottenham and Arsenal, while they have lost against the likes of Swansea, Hull and Leicester. 
Matip admitted it was nice to be able to come out on top in the big games but said the Reds need to start picking up results against the so-called smaller teams. Sadio Mane shoots at goal (Photo: Liverpool FC) Dejan Lovren (left) and Emre Can pose for a picture (Photo: Liverpool FC) Joel Matip was part of the Liverpool team to beat Arsenal on Saturday (Photo: Stuart MacFarlane) 
“Of course it’s nice that we haven’t lost too many points when we have played against the leading sides, but the fact is that you only get three points for a win whether that is against the top team in the division or the bottom,” he told Liverpool's official magazine. 
“We are not alone on the field. We are always up against an opponent who also wants to do well and do their best to win games. Teams did that very well against us during January and we had our problems. Read More Liverpool star James Milner laments inconsistency that has wrecked Reds' title hopes 
“Exactly why we had those problems, I’m not too sure. I don’t know if it was a lack of consistency or what it was, but I do know that every one of us wants to win every game no matter who it is against, and we know that we have the quality to do well. Philippe Coutinho shows off his skills (Photo: Liverpool FC) Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp laughs at Melwood (Photo: Liverpool FC) Alberto Moreno (left) attempts to dispossess Nathaniel Clyne (centre) (Photo: Liverpool FC) 
“You cannot change the past but you can influence the future – so that is the way we must look at it.” 
Liverpool moved into the top four with their win against the Gunners last weekend and they can shore up their place in the Champions League qualification spots with a home victory over Burnley. 
“The next game is always the most important,” added Matip. “The only thing that matters now is the next 90 minutes and we want to do all that we can to keep improving our position. (Left to right) Nathaniel Clyne, Sadio Mane and Georginio Wijnaldum stretch off (Photo: Liverpool FC) Liverpool's players go for a jog (Photo: Liverpool FC) 
“We can look at the Premier League table all we like now, but the only table that counts is the one that is published at the end of the season. Read More "Shy" Luis Suarez insists he was never happy being Liverpool captain - 'I like the low profile' 
“We still have a lot of possibilities to get some points and we must make sure we use them. It will be a hard fight to the finish as there are a lot of teams competing for those top four positions. 
“We have to do everything we possibly can to get back to where we want to be.” Like us on Facebook
